description:
*update: you can order pickup and delivery directly from their website. It's much cheaper. 

I walked by this restaurant and decided to give it a try. I ordered takoyaki and spicy miso ramen. The takoyaki was delicious. The broth for the ramen can use bolder flavor as I didn't really taste the miso flavor. While it's not the best ramen shop in SF but it's not too terrible for the price. Another good thing is that there is hardly any line so for anyone who wants to have ramen without the wait, this is definitely the place to go!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon at around 4. My mom ordered a kimchi pork ramen and I ordered a pork miso ramen. The broths were flavorful and the service was great!
author: Ashley W.

description: Not authentic Japanese ramen.  I give 3 stars for trying but not a place for ramen purists.  Miso ramen lacked true Japanese miso flavoring. This establishment is not owned by Japanese owners.
author: Tony L.

description: I love this secret Ramen shop. The broth is always delicious and the service is also fast !
author: Joseph A.

description: Four Vegan options? Yes! Have never heard of this place before and I stumbled upon it while look for booze for Hardly Strictly Bluegrass 2018 last weekend. We were hungry and needed a boost. Instead of junk food an local liquor store, I stumbled into this place, asked if they did ramen "to go," they said yes. 10 mins later, I had an awesome Vegan Soy flavored ramen for the road. They separated noodles and broth - so it was super fresh when combined. Can't wait to go back here - and try Vegan ramen "in-house." I will re-review this place, if needed, once I try it "in -house."
author: Chad J.

description: To be honest this was not the best. I ordered the teriyaki chicken and it was dry. With the teriyaki chicken there was miso soup and the miso was okay, but it was not the best. I was trying to impress my friend with the many food options in my area but I failed. In conclusion I would not order from here again
author: Nyah M.

description: The wrost salmon teriyaki I even had, it seem uncooked to me, plus I'm not sure is that salmon or some other kind of fish, it also taste awful! Will never come back again!
author: Oscar T.

description: I would give it negative one million stars if I could.  The egg in the ramen soup was cold, sour, and seemingly rotten.  The wings left an aftertaste like the chicken was dead for a hundred years.  I really need a detox!
author: Elena L.

description:
Clean looking restaurant. Service is prompt. 

Miso ramen was a bit bland to me. The flavoring of the broth tasted a bit diluted. The noodles were al dente, a bit too stiff for my preference (I've ate my way through Japan). This is a personal preference, I tend to shy away from foods that are unexpectedly  sweet like the bamboo shoots, just not a fan. 

The garlic miso chicken wings were crispy and nicely flavored. However I think the price is a bit steep for 4 wings ($6).
author: Jess W.

description: My friend and i were in the area and came here for lunch because we wanted noodles. This place has more items then just ramen, they have udon, sushi and sashimi.   My friend got the spicy ramen and i got the tempura udon.   I had some of my friend's ramen and it gave the perfect kick.  It was good if you love it spicy because it was so flavorful..  My udon wasn't bad, but portion was a  little small and the broth was a little salty.  The tempura was average and they did give a lot.   The prices on the other hand were a little bit steep for the price and the portion, but that won't stop me from coming back if I'm in the area again.
author: Belinda C.

description:
When Ramen goes rogue.

I definitely don't think the noodles are freshly made they tasted like they were from a packet and their chicken karrage tastes like popcorn chicken from Kentucky Fried Chicken.

The broth was salty and the bamboo was from a can. The pork was good though so that pushes this up to a 3 star.

With tax and tip for these two items it was almost $20, way too expensive for what you're getting.

Also the service was rude. They were talking in Chinese about their customers being too fat or customers who shared meals and didn't order more.

Poor ediquette for servers.
author: Jack R.

description: The service here is phenomenal!! I ordered a beef ramen and we also ordered a spicy garlic pork ramen! The ramen is really good here, it's chewy and fresh! The beef is really good too, it's cooked perfectly! The pork was pretty good too, there was a lot of fat on it though. The service is really amazing, i highly recommend trying this place out! The atmosphere is really cool too, this is definitely a whole in the wall you MUST try!
author: Carissa C.

description:
Oh la la......All I can say is this is my ramen spot! Sashimi , Jumbo Unagi Don, clod soba, Beef Udon, Bento combo......I've had just about very sashimi item. Hot sake Cold Sapporo.

Always amazing fresh fish here. The service is amazing.

I love here!
author: Eric C.

description:
KIO Ramen is clean, has new decor and a simple japanese design. There were no other patrons in the restaurant when I was there. 

The menu is very simple, and unfortunately the ramen is also...simple and plain. I agree with several other reviews that the broth is very bland. The simple style ramen options are only $11, so at least you get full for a low price. The agedashi tofu was decent; a tad more fried than the more delicate versions of agedashi tofu I've had.  

Basically I wouldn't go out of my way for KIO. Just a place to hold you over if you're in the Balboa neighborhood. 

Bottom Line: Satisfactory ramen.
author: Jaime W.

description:
I've been here so many time never been disappointed I don't mind making the drive here most people mind but I don't mind the distance it's worth it no line to wait and excellent service with great food I come here for the ramen. They also other  stuff check out their menu it's big ! 
I've had ramen from ken ken in Valencia I love it but the down side it gets gets packed on weekends this place is a just as freshly made.
 I hate lines and if you hate line and love great Japanese food this is the place for you and your friends. 
I'm big fan of the 36th balboa restaurants especially this one kio
author: Leslye J.

description: Kio was one of the more disappointing ramen restaurants I've been to in the city. I was excited by the chance to try the soft shell crab, as it's not a common choice, but other than the crab, nothing was really too great about the ramen. The broth tasted like what you find in instant ramen and none of the toppings were particularly flavorful. I did enjoy the karaage appetizers we got.
author: Philip W.

description: Ordered soba noodles, cold ramen, some chicken karrage and California rolls.  Salty, salty, salty.  The California rolls were ok, but man!  take your high blood pressure meds before you eat here.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Small restaurant that wasn't too busy around 9pm on a Friday night. Ordered the Lobster Pork Flavor Ramen ($14.78) which was great! Creamy broth, perfectly boiled ramen egg like bruh the yolk was perfectly gelled and clear, melt in your mouth pork, and a whole soft shell crab. Service and staff were friendly, quick, and excellent, maybe because we were seated next to the kitchen but still! 

AND it's by Purple Kow so you can have your quick boba fix afterward! 

Definitely coming back :)
author: Melanie C.

description: Came here with my wife and 11 month old, as we needed something quick for lunch before my hair cut appointment.  The ramen was a bit pricey for its quality.  The noodles felt processed than fresh made, the egg they indicated on the menu as soft boiled was full cooked/hard boiled and didn't have much flavor, and the broth wasn't piping hot as should be with good japanese ramen places.  The char shu slices was good however and flavorful, and the softshell crab I ordered as a side for my ramen was nicely fried and complemented the ramen well.  Another downside was there wasn't a changing table in the bathroom, so was stuck having to change the baby's diaper on the floor of the bathroom (luckily had a changing pad), so not so convenient for folks with babies, especially since there is only one bathroom for the whole restaurant.
author: Raymond F.

description:
The roommate was craving pho for dinner, but I wanted to try a new spot. Realized KIO Ramen was down the street, so I decided to stop by. I went in on Tuesday, October 11th around 6pm to place an order for takeout.

*Gyoza (4 Pieces): Pork and Cabbage Potstickers ($2.78)
*Karaage: Japanese Style Fried Chicken ($3.58)
*Kio Special Flavor: Base Broth of Pork & Chicken, Chashu, Flavored Egg, Spinach, Bamboo Shoots, Roasted Seaweed, Kikurage ($10.75)

I was debating between the Hella Spicy and the KIO Special. I normally love super spicy food, but I wasn't in the mood to blow my palate in case it was actually hella spicy, so I just went for the KIO special. It wasn't really spicy at all, so I found myself wishing I got the hella spicy. The soup itself isn't necessarily super rich or super light, but I found the broth kind of sour. The bamboo that came with the ramen tasted like it was pickled, so maybe that was why the broth was sour? I'm a fan of spicy and sour soups, but it felt out of place in a bowl of ramen. I had some undercooked ramen noodles earlier in the week, so these were much better. Had a nice chew. The appetizers were good. The karaage was nice and crispy and the gyoza meaty.

Overall, an all right bowl of ramen. I just wish it was richer and didn't have that sour flavor. At least the apps were good.
author: Elena N.

description:
First of all, this place has horrible service. I am writing this the very second I walked out. I was seated relatively fast because I walked in at 9pm on a Sunday. 3 other small tables are seated with people. There's two servers, and after taking my order they didn't ask what I wanted for drinks. I flagged the girl down and told her but she still didn't bring me any water. When my order came out, I asked again and then she finally brings it. This was when there were only two other tables at a tiny restaurant, it's not that hard to forget. 

Fast forward, I am almost done with my food and then I see a black thing in my soup (I ordered the spicy ramen so it was really red I didn't notice it earlier). That was enough for me to lose my appetite completely. 

My God, I only walked in here to try the place out because it's literally a few steps from my house. I will be staying away from now on, first for the horrible service, and second, with that fly. I'm not into that extra protein in my soup.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, unfortunately I will never come here again.

I ordered the garlic miso chicken wings, Kio "specialty" ramen, and water.

No water. Ramen comes out and I ask again for water which finally comes. The presentation is poor. Spinach, stale nori, canned menma, the "flavored" egg was overcooked, noodles tasted like something out of a packet. The broth was so salty I couldn't even sip it (usually with good ramen I finish to the last drop).

Remember the garlic miso wings? Yeah, it came as a dessert when I was already done with the ramen. No "garlic miso" flavor, just fried. So piping hot with hot oil leaking I didn't even dare eat it after being disappointed with the ramen. 

Three people working, six customers. Girl in front of restaurant was talking on her cell phone. The customer next to me had to go to the cashier to pay his bill. Luckily this other waiter came around and brought my check. $21.00 bucks is Definitely. Not. Worth. It. 

Wait for Miki's to open, they know real ramen, or just go somewhere else.
author: Alicia T.

description:
I came here with my brother and mother after picking him up from school. It's pretty empty here on weekday afternoons.

-The ramen made me reminiscent of the instant noodles I had in my cupboards at home. Even though there were different kinds of ramen options, everything had the same ingredients. It's just the soup base that tastes different. 

-They should have lunch specials to have more people eating at their restaurant.

Although the ambiance and decor of the restaurant was nice, the food was meh. After eating here, I wanted to apologize to my favorite ramen places for betraying them. My brother still felt hungry after finishing his whole bowl of ramen.
author: Erica K.

description:
The menu here is SUPER simple (if you like that). I ended up just getting the chicken Karaage and shrimp tempura while my friend ordered the Ramen pork flavor. If you read the actual menu, their ramen bowsl aren't really that different--only spice levels vary. 

I do not recommend ordering the shrimp tempura only because it only came with three superrrr small pieces...and for the price it isn't too worth it. The Karaage was alright, but I've had better. I can't say much about the ramen since I didn't even eat the ramen (heh) but my friend did mention how there was actually not that much ramen, despite it being in such a big bowl. 

The service though, was GREAT!! Very friendly staff and welcoming vibes (=
author: Mary L.

description: Service is slow and not good. Wait staff is inattentive. Food is decent. They give you lots of ramen noodles with each order.
author: Jane L.

description:
For those hesitant to try this place, DO NOT BE HESITANT. This place is GRREEATT. Conveniently located on Balboa and 36th/37th, near Purple Kow, KIO is an amazing ramen addition to the Richmond district. 

I came with two other friends not really expecting much, but we were pretty amazed at the food.

You have a choice of four different soup bases for ramen (see picture), each starting at $9.78. From there, you can add in different things at an extra cost. So I ordered a pork base ramen with a side of Ton katsu (that's fried pork cutlet) and extra noodles. We also ordered some gyoza and chicken karrage as sides. 

Usually with ramen joints, I don't get full with just a bowl, so you know ya boy had to order extra noodles to fill that belly up. But ya know honestly, the portion sizes they give you is enough that I could have done without the extra noodles.

But ANYWAAY back to the ramen. The base is made fresh daily and wasn't too salty (Waraku take notes!). It is slightly spicy though, but not so spicy that it completely destroys you. The ramen noodles themselves were at a perfect consistency. The charsiu was nice and tender. The egg could have been better though. I prefer the more yolky, liquidy kinda egg, but the one here was a tad bit over cooked. It was still delicious nonetheless. 

I personally think that the side dishes are where this place truly shines. The Katsus and chicken karrage here may be the best I've ever had. They are super crunchy and not too dry! The sides are also pretty cheap! I think they were all under $4-5 an order so we got a lot.

The service was good as well. The owner was super friendly and walked around frequently to ask us if everything was fine. Don't worry Mr.! Your food is the bombbbbb.com

Overall this is an amazing new ramen place. I'll definitely be coming back in the future! Try it out!!
author: Golden H.

description:
Came here for dinner and it was pretty empty. I was debating on whether to order the hell spicy ramen or the Kio special. Ended up with the Kio special because I was too scared to try the extra spicy one. Happy with my choice because it was just spicy enough for me. 

The ramen was okay. Nothing was wrong with it, but definitely not great. Compared to all the ramen I've ever tried, this one is no more than decent. Worth a try, but wouldn't ever go out of my way for this.
author: Annie H.

description: Tiny little place that has a nice relaxed feel to it.  I hate the Tonkotsu Ramen (GF), hot sake, and a California roll.  The roll was generously portioned, but not very tightly rolled.  It tasted pretty good.  The sake was a large portion and pretty nice.  The ramen was great.  The broth was rich and hearty, the pork was was melt in your mouth, and the egg was perfectly cooked.  The only issue I had was with the noodles.  While GF noodles tend to always be firm, these ones needed a bit more cooking time because they were too firm.  Maybe if they steamed them for a minute or two before it would have fixed it, because once you get a bowl of ramen infront of you, you gotta start eating.  I gave 4 stars because of the roll composure.
author: Patrick W.

description:
GOOD:
- outstanding appetizers
- modern & pleasant atmosphere
- very fast service during off-peak hours
- good prices 

BAD:
- ramen wasn't very flavorful
- small dining area

I decided to try this place during off-peak hours because I wanted to avoid waiting for a table. It was worth it. We were immediately seated and our food arrived within 15 minutes of ordering. I went with my brother so that we could try more things off the menu. I highly recommend ordering multiple appetizers. You only get four pieces for the appetizers that we ordered, which was perfect because there were two of us. The gyoza was very crispy on the outside and absolutely delicious. The miso chicken wings were outstanding. They were crispy and perfectly seasoned, allowing you to actually taste the chicken. I also ordered chicken katsu as an extra with my entree. The fried chicken strips were perfectly cooked. They were crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside. They were not that flavorful, though, but the sauce that came with it more than made up for it. Best... Sauce... EVER. 

We both ordered Ramen for our entrees. My brother got the classic pork flavored broth and I ordered my personal favorite, classic miso. Compared to other ramen restaurants that I've been to, the classic ramen here is quite mild in flavor. The broth was lightly flavored with miso and the vegetables added a rich, earthy flavor that was very satisfying. The pork strips were fatty and delicious. I tried my brother's soup broth and it was also mildly flavored, but had an earthier overtone. My only real complaint about the ramen with that the noodles were a little more al-dente then I prefer. Despite the soups not being very flavorful, they were still rich and satisfying. 

Overall we had a very positive experience here and we'll definitely be coming back to try something other than the ramen.
author: Chris S.

description: Fianlly tried this restaurant and i really like it. I ordered classic ramen in miso broth with extra bamboo shoots, and fried chicken wing as the appetizer. I think they are very generous compared to a lot of other ramen places, and everything tasted healthy (not too salty or too greasy) and yummy! Will definitely come back and try more dishes!
author: Yuan Z.

description: I ordered the Classic Ramen, the noodle taste delicious and I love the soup so much!!! I really recommend their California roll as well :)
author: Ling L.

description:
Ordered lunch here on Saturday and got the Takoyaki and bento box with Tonkatsu and assorted tempura. 

It took a little while for both of the dishes to come out. The food is pretty average. Takoyaki was good, but I've had equivalent/better ones that come in the frozen pack at Nigiya. 

The bento box was alright as well. The assorted tempura had a little too much tempura on it which made it cook weird. The tonkatsu was OK at best.

Overall, the food is okay.
author: James D.

description:
I wasn't expecting much when coming here, but I am content with the service and overall food efficiency.

There is only one server, so service is a little on the slower side, but I think they did well to the best of their abilities. They were quick to refill cups and I would give their service 4/5!
The california rolls were not too bad, they were a little on the harder side, but I can't complain. 3/5
The sashimi combo was good. It wasn't the freshest, but the portion sizes made up for its hardness. 3/5
The ramen was plain, but again large portion sizes. 2/5

Overall, it was an average experience
author: Jessica Z.

description: I have seen much improvement since the start of Kio.  Everything is in good portion size: their sashimi are thick!!   The beef teriyaki in the combination bento box in decent amount and are sliced thin, so the meat are full of flavor.   I especially like their unagi don and tuna tatami sashimi....so yummy!  Their ramen is good too with delicious roasted pork and soup base.   Tried a few different type of their ramens and they are consistently good.  I took one star out because their calamari is kinda rubbery and the tempera has a very thick "crust".
author: Shirley C.

description:
Not sure about the food, never was able to order or eat. 
No one was in the restaurant we we tried to eat there. 
All I can say is they did not want me my friend and especially my Service Dog in the restaurant. They made that abundantly clear by ignoring us and giving the stink eye...

Good luck fellows...
author: Bryan E.

description:
Found this place while looking around outer Richmond for a place for a dinner break. Place was pretty quiet which was nice. 

The menu was pretty simple, you pick your broth and they all come with standard toppings like chashu, egg etc. You can add a huge variety of other things as extras. I got the pork broth and it was good. 

They also have pretty cheap sides. I got chicken karaage for under $4. It wasn't anything amazing though, could have been a bit tastier. 

Overall a decent ramen shop.
author: Ringo S.

description:
Only had take-out. 

Food = okay. Disappointed.

Kio Special Flavor (Miso, Homemade Chili Paste, Garlic) Ramen = noodles were okay, very al dente; toppings were good (bamboo shoots, spinach, wood ear mushrooms, boiled egg, roasted seaweed & chashu). Chasu was the best thing about this. Broth was definitely as described. $11.28

Gyoza (4 Pcs) = good. $2.78

Prices = reasonable to moderate. Dinner for one came out to $15.29 (before $2.00 EAT24 coupon).
author: Fannie S.

description: Tried the lunch special with calamari and tonkatsu, it was delicious and great value! I will come back to try their ramen..
author: Berk G.

description:
2.5 STARS.

I was skeptical based on the mixed Yelp reviews, but my bf wanted to check this new establishment out, so I figured why not.

The space is relatively small and there were a few other parties in the restaurant. We were seated promptly. I ordered a medium spicy pork flavor ramen (includes chasu, bamboo shoots, half an egg, spinach, roasted seaweed, and kikurage mushooms), while he got the Kio special (medium spicy miso garlic pork base soup, same toppings). 

Honestly, I was not impressed. While my broth had a milky, flavorful broth, the ramen noodles were overcooked for my taste and was reminiscent of instant ramen left out to soak up the water for too long. It was mushy and did not have that al dente texture that I enjoy. The egg was flavorful, but the bamboo was a complete miss for me. It tasted like it came straight out of a can. I even made sure to bury it under everything else so that I could eat it last, in hopes that it would change the taste and texture. Nope, it was still dry and just all around not good. In regards to the KIO special, I felt that the soup base was overly salty and I unfortunately had that thirsty taste in my mouth for the rest of the afternoon.

The noodle portion was HUGE, so it'll definitely fill you up. I didn't finish my ramen and even though the prices were decent, I won't be back for a second round.
author: Leslie C.

description:
Easily the worst restaurant I've been to in a very long time. The ramen is flavorless and overpriced. But the absolute worst dish was this weird teriyaki grilled squid. I actually gagged while eating it.

If you're craving ramen, go down the street to Miki, which is hands down the best ramen outside of Japan. Unfortunately they were closed one night which is why we ventured to this disaster of a restaurant, but next time I'll just wait until Miki is open.
author: June L.

description:
I stopped in here on a whim because I was starving, and noodles sounded so good. 
The menu reads well- they have lots of options for ramen, including vegetarian ramen, which is what drew me in. 

Considering as they call themselves a noodle house and are mainly advertising their ramen, I expected my soup to be delicious, or at least good. 
I ordered the vegetarian ramen with miso broth and added egg. They brought me my ramen and immediately noticed that they had put quail eggs instead of the regular egg. No big deal. Until I tried one of the quail eggs. They were tough and rubbery and tasted old. They were obviously overcooked. 
No problem, I'll just put them aside. 

The broth in this soup was so bland. I had to reinvent the broth myself with chili powder, salt, and ginger from the sushi, but it was still the most tasteless, saddening broth I've ever had the misfortune of drinking. 

The noodles were the only saving grace for this soup, but since the broth was so disappointing, I ended up taking the noodles to go so I could just fry them up later for a snack. 

Luckily for my boyfriend, he ordered a shrimp tempura bento box with a California roll and had zero qualms with his meal. 

Perhaps they should just advertise themselves as a Japanese restaurant in general, not a ramen joint, since ramen clearly isn't their strong suit. 

I gave two stars because service was good, and the interior is simple and nice.
author: Lindsay L.

description: No flavor at all! I ordered a miso flavor and it supposed to be much heavier broth than the original one, but it just no flavor at all. Worst miso ramen ever.
author: Steven X.

description:
I can't recall ever in my life stopping in the middle of a meal and just too displeased to eat the food in front of me. Both me and my girlfriend just couldn't eat the food, the miso ramen and the curry ramen were both terrible. The broth, noodle, toppings everything just not good at all.

Save your money, find a different spot
author: Adam W.

description: Just happened to park in front of this restaurant. My daughter wanted ramen so we ended up eating here. We came at 3:30pmish when there was nobody in the restaurant. My wife and I had the sashimi salad. My eldest daughter had the miso ramen and our youngest had the salmon/seaweed salad bento. The food was excellent. What a find!
author: Donato L.

description:
Great ramen! Good service, nice place...great prices!
8.26.17 Menu has been updated with more items and choices. My favorite is still the Classic shoyu  ramen. Ramen bowl now $1 more but a whole egg and more slices of pork belly now...great warm bowl for cool San Francisco evenings!
author: E W.

description: Ramen is good here. They give a lot of noodles in a big bowl. The waitress is really nice! I ordered spicy ramen & she told me I could add spicy flakes if I wanted it even spicier. She was really friendly and asked how the food was. It was so big that I took home most of it. I like how they separate the noodles from the soup so it does not get soggy. Would recommend to check out if you are in the Richmond district. I like how its open for lunch as most ramen places are only open for dinner.
author: Colette L.

description:
We stopped in this neighborhood restaurant after seeing a big sign for "RAMEN" out in front. This place is great! Here's why...

- Service was wonderful. Our waitress was naturally really friendly to all of the restaurant goers and made nice conversation. She was quick to respond to anything we needed and made us feel very comfortable.
- The food was delicious. Their signature "Kio" Ramen was delicious as was the traditional Miso flavor. All of the produce & meat tasted fresh and tender (I am a stickler for my meats). 
- The prices were right on. 
- Great, casual, comfortable ambiance. They even have a TV if you are trying to watch the Warriors game :)

Overall, this spot is a great place to enjoy a quick, delicious meal in a beautiful "one street" town sort of feel. I would recommend it to anyone to stop by!
author: Sam S.

description:
I ordered the specialty ramen called kio ramen. It was a medium spicy ramen and was served nice and hot. Overall solid ramen, although I think the saltiness of the ramen was moderate I felt like it needed a pinch more, but that's just me. Otherwise the serving was good.

The place is small, but I didn't have a problem getting seating and there was almost a full house. They have a bar wall table that is good if you're just eating by yourself. Great place will probably return for their bento boxes. Give it a try!
author: chris L.

description: Ordered Vegetable Tempura Soba for takeout. Ended up with Vegetable Soba (no tempura), which is supposed to come with seasonal vegetables. It had maybe a dozen kernels of sweet corn and, wait for it... iceberg lettuce. I called to confirm and yes, it was intentional. I mentioned that it was an unusual choice in a soup. I suggested maybe spinach or cabbage. Their response: "We are sorry that you do not like lettuce. We will be happy to substitute spinach or cabbage for you next time." Friendly, considerate staff but as this was my first time ordering from them (and they gave me the wrong order to begin with) I wonder what "seasonal vegetables" they'll come up with in the spring, summer and fall.
author: Jackie J.

description:
Best vegetarian ramen in San Francisco, by far.
ive had vege Ramens all over the city and this one is by far the most flavorful. The service was also great and the prices are reasonable
author: Yarden E.

description: This is my new go-to ramen place in the Outer Richmond if I want to satisfy my ramen craving.  The portion and prices are decent, and the flavor is authentic. Service is pretty good.  I usually get the pork bone ramen, which comes with 3 pieces of pork belly, bamboo shoots, 1/2 egg, and seaweed.  Noodles are perfect for me - springy and great texture.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
This bowl of ramen actually made me sad. I was excited for a new ramen place in the neighborhood and really wanted to like it, opting for this over the 4 star place down the block hoping the lackluster yelp reviews were wrong. But they weren't. :(

I ordered the original ramen with pork broth, and added fried garlic, extra spinach, and quail eggs. The moment I dug into the bowl, I knew I had made a mistake coming here. The ramen noodles looked a lot like instant ramen noodles, and when I took a first sip of the broth my heart sank. There was no flavor, there was no love. The half braised chicken egg that came with it had a yolk that looked and tasted stale and gelatinous. 

How can so many good looking ingredients taste so flat? I actually had to add soy sauce to get even a little depth of flavor. I forced myself to finish what I could because mom taught me not to waste food, but it was a struggle. 

The two stars is because decor was nice, and service was okay. Otherwise 1 star for the sad noodles. If this is what they do with their signature dish, how can anything else here be good? Would not come again.
author: L. S.

description:
Nice little hole in the wall locale. Seating arrangement is kind of cramped. I think it would do the servers and customers alike a favor if the individual tables were less so that there would be space in between. 

The menu is relatively small and simple, which I like. Not confusing or complicated. Straight forward which makes ordering easy. 

The food was only okay. My girlfriend had the miso ramen and I had the shoyu ramen. It did its job in making us full, but it was barely memorable. The choice of their meat in their ramen was different, kind of bland. Broth was good, but the rest could use some improvement. Portion size was average. 

Considering this place is new, it has a lot of potential. I would give this place a second chance if I ever happen to be in the neighborhood and needed a place to eat, but otherwise Tanpopo, Waraku, ramen Yamadaya, and a bunch others would be a better choice.
author: Killah K.

description: Stopped by for lunch.  I had the beef udon and my buddy had the pork ramen.  Both meals were very underwhelming.  Noodles were undercooked, beef was overcooked.  Broth was not right.  There was iceberg lettuce in the noodles.  (How do you screw up udon?).   Anyway we had to wake up the guy at the register to pay and leave.
author: Matt S.

description:
I had a shoyu ramen. Just one word, OMG.
This is the worst ramen that I have been eating since I move to San Francisco.
My best experience was Yuzu ramen. A high qualityand organic.
I will never come back to this restaurant.
If you want to waist your money, i will say that
" go a head, and good lunck"
author: Hyunjun Y.

description: Solid ramen place. We had the kio ramen and our kids had the classic pork ramen. The broths were flavorful and the soft boiled eggs were cooked perfectly. The ramen noodles weren't the best I've ever had but they were good. Prices are reasonable for SF. We will be back!
author: Emily C.

description: I ordered a classic pork ramen. Overall it is average it doesn't taste good or bad. Only good here is the pork and the soft shell crab. The crab is worth to order.
author: Jacques S.

description: I give them no stars for the food, but I will leave them with one star for the service they provided us with at least. Honestly, never had ramen I couldn't put in my mouth...The hella spicy ramen tasted like spicy water and the ramen itself had a weird soap-like taste. Bamboo shoots and the black stuff came out cold. The pork was sour... I don't know what was good here. Karaage wasn't fried right either and I'm not sure how you mess up on fried food. What a bad start on Christmas Eve :(
author: Tina P.

description:
Great place for ramen, good service too :)  Had the hell spicy flavor, yes very spicy, but it kills the good taste of the broth, my husband had the regular, which is much better.  Also, I had a soft shell crab topping, that wasn't fresh, tasted off a bit.

Overall, if you just get the regular pork ramen, it is very tasty!
author: Meiko S.

description: Delicious vegan meals are hard to find in the Richmond and I'm so happy we found KIO! Even their tempura batter is eggless and delicious. I had spicy veggie ramen, eggplant agadashi, hot tea, and edamame. My wild 4 year old ate soba noodles with veggie tempura - and he ate with his hands shoving the food into his mouth. (I'm such a good mom) I'll be back soon, KIO!
author: Eva H.

description:
The food is pretty good and tasty. 
The environment is pleasant. 
The waitress are nice and polite. 
I would come here again next time. 

Oh, my only problem was eating the Tsukemen. I was confused.
author: Alberto W.

description: I'm not a Ramen expert. And so I had the vegetarian version, and added crispy garlic and bean sprouts. The broth was spicy and delicious. The server was super sweet and super prompt. My green tea was constantly topped off with a smile. This was just a simple enjoyable easy dinner after a long day at a conference. A welcome change from much of the hustle and bustle of downtown. The space is bright and clean and cozy and I will definitely go back!
author: Nellyda A.

description:
Wow! This ramen place is really good. I eat a lot of ramen and I know when I said I found a good place. This place. I got the classic ramen with pork flavor, medium spicy and extra egg. MAN OH MAN. The egg is so good, like SO good. Lots of flavor and their chashu is so tender and soft. It's one size only. Their karrage is really good too, good service! 

Will be back
author: Ritney N.

description:
Decent ramen restaurant in the Outer Richmond.  They took over half of the 
Americana Grill restaurant and this is an area that needs a restaurant like this.  

I had the pork ramen.  Broth was decent, but not outstanding.  The menu is very simple with mainly ramen, rice dishes, and a few appetizers.  We probably will go back again because of the location but they may need to add a few more ramen varieties to make it interesting.
author: Re-pley Z.

description:
I have been eating here couple of times and love how they spend their time and real food to make their broth.  The whole restaurant serves no msg and the owner told me she has made much of the ingredients in the house.  

The owners take advise and they adjust according to our feedback. The menu grew from a few items to more options.

Nice to give it a try.
author: Wing W.

description:
Disappointing and below average. Ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry and Grilled Squid appetizer. The chicken was pounded/flattened extremely thin, breaded and fried. The result was a dry and tough chicken cutlet. Just imagine eating a deep fried piece of leather. The curry sauce was thin and runny. At most other restaurants, the curry sauce is thick and more like gravy. I suspect the "sauce" was used was a curry ramen broth or something. The rest of the dish was passable (rice, couple of pickles, bland tomato slices and shredded cabbage). It would be hard to mess that up. The grilled squid dish arrived at our table stone cold. The wait staff sent the dish back as we requested. The second attempt was slightly warmer. The waitress told us that the sauce that had been used was cold. They used way too much sauce IMHO as well.

The service is decent but the food is way below average. Halfway through the meal we just wanted to finish and get out of there.
author: Dan T.

description:
Ramen had a strong flavor of fresh garlic, hard to make me say it was too much, but it was.
Service was iffy at best, had no water the second half of my meal, my server had to get up from her meal to give me my check, never asked how anything was. Fried tofu wasn't bad, always excited to try new places especially if they are walking distance from my house, unfortunately I don't think I'll return, too much competition in the city for good ramen to settle for poor service and mediocre ramen.
author: Nathan B.

description:
We just ate here and our food was great!  (Bonus for being open for Christmas Eve!!). My brother got the Hell Special Flavor Ramen and it was the kind of hot to me that didn't add any flavor but just added heat. He enjoyed it until he tasted my broth and agreed that mine was some of the best ramen we've had recently. I got the Kio Special Flavor and it was so good. At first I thought I wanted it a little more spicy, but by the end I was content with my choice but a little more heat would have been fine too. With it being cold outside, it was awesome to be able to have yummy ramen where I wanted to drink all of the broth. 

We also had the Gyoza which were incredible and we thought were possibly made on site since they tasted so fresh compared to most places. My only complaint was that it came out with my ramen instead of shortly before, but in the long run that worked out well for us.

Right before we finished we ordered some fried eggplant and assorted tempura to take back to the house for the others. One piece of the fried eggplant was pretty greasy but it was the piece at the bottom of the container. The rest of the fried eggplant and the tempura had some grease but were tasty.

Overall we plan on coming back for Kio Special Ramen and Gyoza for sure and to slowly try other elements of the menu to see if we find any other favorites!
author: Crystal A.

description: If I could rate lower than 1 star I would. Extreme buyer beware. The food was not fresh and the egg was definitely rotting "part of a witch's stew" as my friend put it. Not customer service. Bad experience no refills on water. The broth was gross and the noodles tasted like top ramen. Gross!!!!!!!!
author: April D.

description: My daughter is very picky. Especially with her favorite, ramen. She said the soup was tasty, less fat. That means we will come back again for ramen. Why 4 stars only? The waiter took so long to give us the bill. He passed us 4-5 times, didn't even bother to check our table. It's a small place and it wasn't even full when we were done.
author: The Black Cat C.

description: I ordered the pork flavor ramen here, and it was decent.  Nothing great like compared to other ramen restaurants I've been to, but not terrible either.  I don't know... Maybe it was the broth? I also didn't like the Chashu.  It's not like the pieces of red meat one might imagine at other Asian restaurants; instead it reminded me of boiled bacon.  I was disappointed I didn't even get a whole egg, too.
author: Eric L.

description:
Good price for the quality, although the meat was lacking (is that common for Ramen places? Sure seems so). Taste is top shelf and the soup base is great. Customer service is not bad either.

I am hesitant to knock off a star for the 2 pieces of meat solely because in my experience most Ramen places are like this. 

Contents are spinach, Bambu, chasu with the classic meat choice and soup base. Spicy isn't that spicy at the medium level (I'm not that tolerant so take that however you like). Overall comparable to most other great tasting Ramen places albeit at a slightly higher cost.

Overall I would recommend it and I would come back as I was seated right away and the food came quick. The extra cost and lack of meat isn't that big a deal to me and was definitely worth it.
author: Nick W.

description:
Food was great.

Food ordered
Kaarage
Soft shell crab
Tempura
Hell Spicy
KIO
Pork

Here on a Sunday holiday.  Food served was slow.  Half table was almost done eating while other half waited!  There was 7 at our table.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Nothing really special about this new place. 

Got the Classic Pork Ramen which taste fine but nothing to brag about. 

Avoid the Edamame...I personally love edamame and I'm not sure how you can mess it up. But it tasted very bland with no flavor....this was probably the main reason for the 3 stars

Menu is simple so I think people will like that. 

Not a bad place to go to if you're in the area and craving Ramen but Probably would not a drive. 

I like that it was neat Purple Kow which is where I went to afterwards.
author: Kevin C.

description: Food are unique. We ordered unagi don and tsukemen. Super tasty and can't find it elsewhere in SF. Their prices are very fair. Services are good as well. Will definitely come back even though I live faraway.
author: Angela C.

description: Tried the Kio Special, Pork Ramen, and the Karrage everyone is raving about. First of all i can't even compare this place to the spots i go down in SM.  Pork ramen broth was tasteless. The Kio Special ingredients are just not there and the soup base is gross. I don't even know how to describe it. It's not fresh and can probably pass for an instant soup base or something. The fried chicken is subpar the batter was thick and i'd be happy with nuggets instead. If you have high expectations for a good bowl of ramen pass on this place. Even if you need a quick fix i wouldn't do it. I've been spoiled with good ramen.
author: Larry L.

description: Bland ramen unfortunately. The nice thing is though, that they do put a lot of noodles in the bowl. Other than that nothing special. Also had the gyoza and it was yummy.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Ramen: 4 to 4.5 (tonkotsu/pork flavor soup base is good)

Appetizer: takoyaki is a 3 (where is the tako?) and karaage is a 3.5 (chicken not juicy)

My suggestion is to stick to the ramen
author: Alan P.

description: Love that they are open until 11PM! Ordered the Grilled Calamari appetizer and Lobster Pork Flavored Ramen. Both tasted great. The squid was the perfect texture. Not chewy from being overcooked. A nice alternative to calamari always being breaded and deep fried. The ramen broth hit the spot and the soft shelled crab tempura that came with it was the cherry on top! Great late night spot!
author: Kitty L.

description:
I thought the ramen and service was okay.
I ordered:
-karaage
-Kio special
-agedashi tofu

Chicken karaage batter was light and crispy. Not bad. The tofu was not silky but very dense and similar to Chinese tofu. The ramen broth was ok, a little watery, but the individual ingredients were good.
author: Andrew E.

description: I've been here twice. The first time I got the pork broth classic ramen and it was average. It wasn't particularly memorable, but it was fine. The second time I got the miso broth classic ramen and was very disappointed. It was absolutely flavorless. The food takes quite a while to come out, which would make you think they were doing something special in the kitchen, but the food I've tried doesn't reflect that. There is better ramen a few doors down. Try another place instead.
author: Brian F.

description: Miki was closed for vacation so we tried Kio. Sorry to say it was very poor. Our family each ordered the same thing and they got our entire order wrong. However, we were hungry we decided to just eat what was in front of us. We got vegetable soba and the broth was oily and very bland. The soba noodles had a terrible texture and were inedible. I feel badly giving them one star because they seemed nice but I left my food so I can't really inflate the review much.
author: Bianca G.

description: I had been craving ramen all weekend while visiting SF, and we left very disappointed. The ramen we ordered Shoyu, and Pork were both bland, the tonkatsu my husband ordered for his ramen was not breaded in panko, but rather in shake n bake. We also ordered two appetizers, the gyoza and chicken karrage. The karrage was oily and not tasty, they also don't offer kewpie mayo here. The gyoza was not bad although it did taste like the frozen store bought. Definitely not freshly made.
author: Ruby Y.

description: Had the Hell Spicy Ramen. Literally Tapatío hot sauce soup. Yuck.
author: A W.

description: I have to say that this is probably the worst ramen that I have eaten. First, the broth is almost flavorless (I ordered the classic ramen with pork soup, in medium spicy). Medium spicy is not spicy at all. I had to add chili flakes to my ramen. The noodles are soggy. They look and taste 'over-cooked'. I think they just blanch the noodles in a separate pot, then add the noodles to the bowl. The pork slices are ok. The best part of my meal was the egg. The 1 star given is for the service and the egg. I am very disappointed.
author: Kitty L.

description: No!!!! Don't eat here....had a bento where the shrimp was so hard and old could barely bite into it and the only way I recognized the salmon was a slight fishy odor. Otherwise it was a burnt piece of stringy "something" in teriyaki sauce.
author: Tina H.

description:
First Service is good. The waitress checked up on us to see if everything was fine. My pork ramen was good. My husband's kio ramen was a bit too salty! The miso chicken wings was a bit too salty too but tolerable. I understand everyone's tastebuds r different. Anyways! Lets start my complaint! 

Heres why i gave 3 stars. My husband order Kio Ramen and in () it says miso, garlic, etc.. i thought it was referring to the soup base options. So i told the waiter ok we want garlic base. Then when the bill comes i saw $1.50 for fried garlic! I told the waiter we never ordered fried garlic we just wanted the garlic base which i poked to him on the menu! Then he said OH the garlic base is included with miso! Hello!! Im like ok so if the garlic base is included why did u charge me freaken $1.50 for Fried Garlic which i never requested!! He took the bill and my credit card and charged it!! Im like ok fine! I can afford $1.50 but i felt like i was ripped off and im not coming back! 

Overall, the waitress service was friendly! My pork ramen was good! But the sneaky tag on bill is a BS!!
author: Catherine L.

description: The KIO Special broth was very tasty, and just the right amount of spiciness. It's better than the spciy miso broth offered at a few other ramen shops. I liked the assortment of toppings in the soup.  Nice that they are open until 11pm, which is "late" for the Outer Richmond.
author: David S.

description: Not so good.  Soup cold. Noodles no flavor. Smokes outside the restaurant smoke coming in. Anyway lots of orher ramen places. Not a snooty review but you gabe to get your act together..
author: Jorydude R.

description: I love to try the new place. Yesterday I went to this restaurant. Telling u the true. I do not like ramen because it is normal. But I do a change after I tried here. It is so delicious. I order the basic ramen. The soup is so good is created by chief. It is very special. And it is large size. Actually I love the soup.
author: Fay M.

description: This is now my go to place for ramen! Love the chicken Katsu. Only think I get, so only thing I can rave about.
author: Jane D.

description: Tried this place again. Had their KIO special. Broth was a bit more richer and was a bit more flavorful. Of course had a softshell crab too. Will return when I'm the hood.
author: Ming W.

description: Nice and clean. Ordered spicy veggie Ramen. Really good! Hubby likes his pork soup base Ramen too. Will definitely come back.
author: X Y.

description: Delicious ramen! We needed an early dinner and this place was the only one that stayed open between the traditional lunch and dinner hours. We were very happy with the food, and the service was friendly and fast. The only caveat is that you're limited to on street parking if you come by car. Maybe not a big deal for locals, but a factor to consider.
author: Jay M.

description:
It's been my quest for the last 2 years to find the best Ramen spot in SF; needless to say, I've tried a lot of different bowls of ramen. I just found this place in the outer richmond and was told they've only been open for a month. It was awesome. 

I tried the Kio special, added Soft Shell Crab and Fried Garlic and it was perfect. Just enough spice, big portion, and everything was terrific. 

Definitely near the top of my ramen rankings. Give this spot a try and thank me later.
author: Joel D.

description: I had the KIO Ramen house special. Unfortunately, there's not much flavor for the soup base. However, the pork was good and they give you three pieces. Most likely I won't be back unless they drastically make the soup base better.
author: Jackson N.

description: This place is great! I was hesitant because there's already a ramen place down the street as well as a couple places that do ramen, but I have to say KIO Ramen does it the best. Plus some of the employees from the previous place April Calf still work there! I loved those guys, so it was really great to see them. The ramen was amazing, but the tempura was honestly what sold me. It's perfectly crispy with hardly any grease to it, and the sauce that it comes with is perfect! I can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
author: Benny G.

description: Portion quite reasonable however the soup base is way to salty... will need to ask to light up the base when ordering
author: Dan Y.

description: We thought that we would give it a try. But was not impressed with the noodles. Have had better. The noodles are not Japanese but I think Chinese chow mien noodles. They we a tad over done.  Nothing special about the broth.
author: Frances L.

description: It is very average, 10 dollars for a very small amount of ramen. Its pretty average compared to the other ramen places. Shrimp tempura is overpriced though, 4 dollars for 3 small-medium pieces.
author: J C.

description: Service was very good. Friendly fast servers. Ramen came out just as ordered and piping hot. Perfect for a chilly day. The other reviews said it was tasteless? Maybe the recipes changed because everything was very flavorful!!
author: Kat P.
